thread.title: Grandma settles police brutality case, to receive $125K - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: Grandma settles police brutality case, to receive $125K - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: Grandma settles police brutality case, to receive $125K - Massachusetts news
text:
WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) — A grandmother who accused a police officer of slamming her to the floor in a 2013 racially-motivated outburst has settled her lawsuit.
Sixty-three-year-old Daisy Morales in federal court accused a Worcester police officer of insulating her race, beating her mercilessly and issuing false charges to cover up his alleged misdeeds.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Morales tells the Telegram & Gazette (http://bit.ly/1Z2flP1 ) that she wanted to ‘‘get it over with’’ and that facing the officer in court was too much to bear.
She settled her federal lawsuit with the city for $125,000.
The police officer accused in the case remains on the force. City officials Friday declined to state the results of the department’s internal investigation or say whether the officer faced discipline.
___
Information from: Telegram & Gazette (Worcester, Mass.), http://www.telegram.com
